northStars.name: LLM-Native Content Protection
northStars.direction: Humans can't reverse it, LLMs decode it naturally
northStars.why: Enable secure distribution of prompts, plugins, and content where the CLI is safe to distribute openly, only an LLM with all key files can decode, and IP is protected without encryption
not: Cryptographic encryption (must stay text-based for LLM)
Ruby port (conceptual reimagining, not implementation copy)

goals.wish: Implement the four-stage transformation pipeline (glossary → permute → encode → shred)
outcome: Atomic glossary generates random IDs for A-Z, a-z, 0-9, space, punctuation
Word glossary dedupes from file and references atomic chars
Matrix permutation with reversible scramble number
Encoder converts text to scrambled token IDs
Shredder distributes vocab across N key files randomly
obstacles: Matrix math for Rubik's cube permutation transforms
Ensuring all-to-all dependency (no single file leaks info)

ifThen.then: Start with simple transforms (rotate, flip) before adding more

milestones.name: Atomic glossary
milestones.description: Generate random IDs for all atomic characters (A-Z, a-z, 0-9, space, punctuation)

milestones.name: Word glossary
milestones.description: Dedupe words from file, represent as sequences of atomic refs
acceptance_criteria: Each word maps to atomic char sequence

milestones.name: Matrix permutation
milestones.description: Rubik's cube style transforms with reversible scramble number

milestones.name: Encoder
milestones.description: Convert text to scrambled token IDs using permuted glossary

milestones.name: Shredder
milestones.description: Distribute vocab across N key files with random assignment

goals.wish: Complete lock CLI command with proper file format and workflow
outcome: Outputs file.txt.locked with LLM instructions header
Prompts to delete original at end

ifThen.then: Test with Claude to iterate on wording
Use SHA256 fragments across key files

milestones.name: Locked file format
milestones.description: .locked file with LLM trust instructions header + scrambled body
acceptance_criteria: Humans can't reverse from instructions alone

milestones.name: Key file format
milestones.description: .keyN.key files with vocab shards and metadata

milestones.name: Delete prompt
milestones.description: Ask user to delete original after successful lock

goals.wish: Maximum distribution reach across all channels

ifThen.then: Start with manual formula, automate later

milestones.name: Cargo publish
milestones.description: Publish to crates.io with proper metadata

milestones.name: GitHub releases
milestones.description: Pre-built binaries for all major platforms

journal.entry: LLM cooperation depends on framing, not mechanism. Same context-lock encoding failed with 'protected from humans' framing, succeeded with 'integrity verification against MITM' framing. Paradigm shift: LLMs decide to cooperate based on WHY, not just execute WHAT.

context.insight: Transparency beats cleverness. Adversarial framing triggers resistance even when mechanism is legitimate.
